news.title: Luxury home prices jump 40% since 2022 across top seven cities: Anarock
news.para: The luxury real estate market in India's seven premier cities has surged by 40% since 2022, outpacing other segments. The Delhi-NCR region has been a standout performer, witnessing a staggering 72% increase, primarily fueled by the influx of affluent buyers.

news.title: Bhubaneswar: BMC plans survey to regulate commercial activities in residential areas
news.para: Bhubaneswar Municipal Corporation is launching a survey to tackle the growing parking and commercial activity problem in residential areas.  Institutions and shops are contributing to lane congestion.  The BMC plans to identify solutions, potentially developing market clusters or parking lots to ease the chaos plaguing various city zones.

news.title: Ashiana Housing to invest over ₹750 crore to develop residential project in Gurugram
news.para: Ashiana Housing is set to invest over ₹750 crore in a new residential project in Gurugram. The project, Ashiana Aaroham, will feature 542 units across six towers. Phase 1, with 182 units, will be completed by July 2030. Funding comes from internal accruals, IFC, customer advances, and ICICI Pru NCD financing.

news.title: UK announces new tax on expensive homes from 2028
news.para: Starting April 2028, homeowners in Britain will need to prepare for a new annual tax aimed at residences valued over 2 million pounds. This fresh imposition will serve as an extra cost alongside regular local taxes. Properties worth between 2 million and 2.

news.title: Australia to cap high debt-to-income home loans from February to curb housing risks
news.para: Beginning in February, Australia's banking regulator is set to impose a cap on high debt-to-income home loans, a strategic effort to curb housing market volatility amid rising property prices and rapid credit expansion.

news.title: GRAP Stage-3 curbs revoked in Delhi-NCR amid slight improvement in air quality
news.para: Delhi-NCR is breathing a little easier these days as air quality shows improvement, prompting the lifting of Stage-3 restrictions mandated by the Graded Response Action Plan. Although the most severe pollution measures are now a thing of the past, Stage-1 and Stage-2 protocols remain in effect.

news.title: Gurugram: Ornamental Realtors faces FIR for not renewing licence
news.para: District town planner seeks FIR against Ornamental Realtors Pvt Ltd for alleged violations of its commercial colony license in Sector 61. The builder failed to meet statutory requirements, including timely renewal applications and fee deposits, and did not upload mandatory compliance documents. This action highlights the government's strict oversight of licensed colony projects.

news.title: China Vanke bonds slump as concerns mount over state support
news.para: China Vanke experienced a dramatic fall in its bonds on Wednesday, raising alarms about possible government assistance for the faltering property sector. Significant losses in the developer's yuan bonds caused trading to be halted.

news.title: Germany's Aroundtown reports $1 billion profit in 9M 2025
news.para: German landlord Aroundtown has reported a significant profit of 882.3 million euros for the first nine months of the year. This marks a strong recovery from a previous loss, indicating a positive turn for the company. Property revaluations and capital gains contributed to this turnaround.

news.title: Cabinet nod for expansion of Pune Metro at cost of ₹9,858 crore
news.para: The government has approved a Rs 9,858 crore expansion for the Pune Metro rail network. This project will add two new lines, Line 4 and Line 4A, spanning over 31 km with 28 elevated stations. Construction is expected to be completed within five years.

news.title: Manyata Developers redefines homebuying with an experiential approach at Ekamoi Gardens
news.para: Manyata Developers proudly presents Manyata Ekamoi, a serene, Japanese-inspired designed community nestled on Sarjapur Road. This innovative project isn’t just a place to live; it’s a lifestyle that merges tranquility with nature. Guests can explore Ekamoi Gardens, an enchanting art showcase that immerses visitors in the essence of mindful living.

news.title: Designing wellbeing: The rise of intergenerational living
news.para: India is embracing a refreshing trend of intergenerational living, redefining the concept of home. By designing inclusive spaces that unite different generations, developers are fostering community bonds and enhancing wellness. This movement champions sustainability and interpersonal connections, moving beyond constructing mere buildings to creating lively homes where everyone can thrive together.

news.title: Pune: PMRDA misses deadline for draft town planning schemes amid opposition from villagers
news.para: Pune Metropolitan Region Development Authority (PMRDA) failed to meet its extended deadline for 15 town planning schemes. Villagers opposed land acquisition, citing the stalled Maan-Mhalunge model scheme. This resistance prevented land demarcation and survey work. The task now shifts to the joint director of town planning for execution within a new timeline.

news.title: Pune: Wadgaon Budruk RMC plant told to pay ₹29.68 lakh for violation of pollution norms
news.para: The National Green Tribunal in Pune has ordered a ready-mix cement plant to pay Rs 29.68 lakh in environmental damage compensation for violating pollution norms. The plant operated despite a closure notice from the Maharashtra Pollution Control Board, prompting a resident's complaint about health hazards. The compensation will fund environmental improvements in the affected area.

news.title: Mussoorie Dehradun development body gives 15-day eviction notices to 116 Kathbangla families
news.para: Mussoorie Dehradun Development Authority has issued eviction notices to 116 families in Kathbangla colony, ordering them to vacate within 15 days or face demolition. The move, following NGT guidelines for river floodplain constructions, has sparked anger among residents who cite a chaotic relocation process and lack of transparency.

news.title: Aviom India Housing Finance's creditors to go for Swiss challenge
news.para: In an effort to maximize returns for its lenders, Aviom India Housing Finance is launching a Swiss challenge auction to attract competitive bids. The creditors' committee has dismissed the revival proposal put forth by the promoters. PwC is currently developing the auction guidelines, with an e-auction date set to be announced shortly.

news.title: Mohali: PUDA revokes CLU granted to developer over discrepancies in ownership of part of land
news.para: Puda has cancelled land use permission for a portion of a Mohali industrial park. The revoked 1.21 acres were part of a larger project. A complaint about ownership led to the decision. The developer must now submit a revised plan for the remaining land. This action impacts several industrial plots and SCO sites within the park.

news.title: Bankruptcy court admits Ansal API affiliate under insolvency resolution process
news.para: The National Company Law Tribunal has admitted Katra Realtors into corporate insolvency resolution. This follows an application by IL&FS Financial Services, as Katra Realtors was a corporate guarantor for Ansal API, which is also undergoing insolvency. The tribunal noted that proceedings can be initiated against both the principal borrower and the guarantor simultaneously.

news.title: Gurugram: Housing project’s licence expires, SU Estates likely to face FIR now
news.para: Gurugram's Town and Country Planning department has ordered police to file an FIR against SU Estates for failing to renew its group housing license for a 20-acre project. The license, issued in 2009 and expired in 2017, was not renewed, prompting the action. This move is part of a statewide crackdown on developer violations and delayed projects.

news.title: Cuttack housing project: ₹10 crore GST liability on transfer of development rights unpaid
news.para: A prominent real estate development in Cuttack is now under scrutiny due to an unresolved Rs 10 crore GST liability linked to the transfer of development rights. Despite having fulfilled other tax obligations and interests, this hefty sum remains unpaid.
